name: Defender Rockfowl

topics.topic: AboutBrotherhood1Do you sell any specialty items?
topics.topic_text: How do you feel about the Brotherhood of Steel?
topics.response_text: I used to like serving with them, I really did. But, you know, the technology has to come first.
We've got power armor and big guns and we're the ones doing the talking right now.{Playfully threatening}

topics.topic_text: Good to meet you, Rock. I hope you're on my side.
topics.response_text: Don't shoot at me or my friends, I think we'll get along just fine!

topics.topic_text: Rococo Rockfowl? How did you end up with a name like that?
topics.response_text: Pop had an encyclopedia. He was real proud of it.{Pleasant, but with mild undertones of resentment.}

topics.topic_text: How about I skip right to calling you "Coco"?
topics.response_text: Then I think we'd have a problem. And you don't want to be a problem around here.
Nope. Sorry. Protector Casdin says the locals around here are barely smarter than the Mole Rats.
Defender Rococo Rockfowl, at your service.

conversation.response_text: Don't start anything and you'll be fine. Um, probably.

description:
Defender Rockfowl is a 35 year-old Caucasian Male.

A laid-back yet competent heavy-weapons specialist for the Brotherhood Outcasts, Defender Rockfowl serves at Fort Independence where he guards the bridge from Fairfax ruins against frequent raider incursions. Despite his preference for the Brotherhood's original mission, he chose to follow Casdin's more traditional ideology, aligning himself with the Outcasts.

Defender Rockfowl's Personality: Relaxed and easygoing despite his dangerous role, Rockfowl maintains a casual demeanor that contrasts with his formidable combat skills. Unlike his more rigid counterpart Defender Morgan, he approaches his duties with a practical efficiency that doesn't compromise his effectiveness in battle.

Defender Rockfowl's Backstory: Born to an avid reader in the Capital Wasteland, Rockfowl's father named him after stumbling upon 'Rococo' in the Encyclopedia Atomica (Volume VIII). He joined the Brotherhood of Steel as a young adult, drawn to their mission of preserving technology. When Elder Lyons shifted focus from the Brotherhood's original directive to humanitarian efforts, Rockfowl remained loyal to the cause but ultimately chose to follow Elder Casdin when the Outcasts broke away, sharing Casdin's belief in the Brotherhood's original purpose.
